name: treatment of slaughterhouse waste, rendering | slaughterhouse waste | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/3941/documentation

This dataset represents a rendering plan, treating slaughterhouse waste to tallow and meat and bone meal. The original dataset was physically allocated to the tallow. Since the process of meat and bone meal production is nearly the same as the production of tallow (all steps are common except the milling of the meal), the original allocated inventory was adjusted to the total amount of product output. 

From reception of slaughterhouse waste at the factory gate.

This activity ends with the produced tallow and meat and bone meal. An important emission from rendering is foul odour, which is not quantified in this datset. No indications of other relevant air emissions were found, so no air emissions  were added. There were no data available on waste generation.
category: C:Manufacturing/10:Manufacture of food products/101:Processing and preserving of meat/1010:Processing and preserving of meat

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Based on data from the year 1999.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Values refer to the situation in Switzerland.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Refers to a typical technology for tallow processing in Switzerland. The tallow-production process is described as follows: The animal carcasses and abattoir wastes are crushed in a grinder, then sterilised by steam. They are then dried using steam as a heat source, and finally defatted, a process in which the fat is separated from the greaves. The fat is clarified, while the greaves are milled into meat- and bone meal. The processing paths of tallow and of meat- and bone meal are very similar, diverging only in the final step (milling). The minimum requirements for sterilisation are a temperature of 133 °C and a pressure of 3 bar for 20 minutes (Nottrodt 2001). ;References;Kleinhanss W., Uhlmann F. & Haxsen G. (2000) Folgenabschätzung alternativer Entsorgungsverfahren für Tierkörper und Schlachtabfälle bei einem Verwendungsverbot zur Futtermittelherstellung, 13p. Retrieved on July 11, 2002 from http://www.bal.fal.de/download/Fe_tmverbot.pdf. ;Nottrodt A. (2001) Technische Anforderungen und allgemeine Empfehlungen für die Entsorgung von Tiermehl und Tierfett in Verbrennungsanlagen - Bericht erstellt im Auftrag des Bundesministeriums für Umwelt, Naturschutz und Reaktorsicherheit, 63p. Retrieved on July 11, 2002 from http://www.bmu.de/download/dateien/leitf.pdf.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data come from one rendering plant in Switzerland.

exchanges.description: Estimation. The collected data refer to the total production of meat meal, bone meal and tallow in the rendering plant.The total production figures were divided by the total output of the plant, since the processing of meat- and bone meal on the one hand and tallow on the other are to a large extent the same. The inventory for tallow can therefore also be used for meat- and bone meal. Assuming 40% dry matter and 40% extractable fat in dry matter of slaughterhouse waste.

exchanges.description: Estimation. The use of building infrastructure was estimated from aerial photographs: 3000 m2 is occupied by the buildings (estimated height of 10 m, inventoried as “building, multi-storey”), and the total area is 11,000 m2, which was inventoried as “Occupation, industrial area”. The estimated lifetime of the plant was 50 years, and the occupation as construction site was assumed to be 2 years.

Calculated value based on literature values and expert opinion. See comments in the parametres' comment field.

Estimation. The data were compared to a study from Denmark (COWI 2000) and were found to be quite similar. The use of heating energy given by COWI (2000) is 6.3 MJ per kg tallow, which is slightly lower than the value for the Lyss plant (8.4 MJ/kg). According to COWI (2000), fuel oil is used as the heat source, while the Lyss plant uses natural gas.

Further References:

COWI Consulting Engineers and Planners AS, Denmark (2000) Cleaner production assessment in meat processing. Report prepared for United Nations Environment Programme Division of Technology, Industry and Economics and Danish Environmental protection agency, 367p. Retrieved on July 12, 2002 from <http://www.agrifood-forum.net/publications/guide/index.htm>.
EcoSpold01Location=RER

EcoSpold01Location=CH
Estimation. Electricity consumption is the same in both cases, Lyss plant  and COWI (2000), 0.18 kWh/kg tallow. The data were therefore judged to be sufficiently reliable.

Further References:

COWI Consulting Engineers and Planners AS, Denmark (2000) Cleaner production assessment in meat processing. Report prepared for United Nations Environment Programme Division of Technology, Industry and Economics and Danish Environmental protection agency, 367p. Retrieved on July 12, 2002 from <http://www.agrifood-forum.net/publications/guide/index.htm>.

EcoSpold01Location=CH
Estimation. Data on wastewater production was available for the Lyss plant. The rendering process produces large quantities of wastewater with high nitrogen content and high BOD values. The wastewater is treated in the plant (sterilisation). Since no detailed data were available on the quality of the wastewater produced, the module "sewage, average" was used as a proxy for the wastewater treatment.
